course_title: Art in Japan: The Problem with Painting

sections.comments: ARTH 363 001 will be delivered 100% online, with some synchronous (i.e., "real time") and some asynchronous components. If registration for the course is blocked, it is full and the waitlist ARTH 363 01W has been opened.This class revisits some of the main sites of the history of painting in Japan, introducing their formal aspects as well as examining some of the current debates they have served to ground. The subject of this course is thus both the objects comprised in the modern category "Japanese painting" and the category "Japanese painting" itself. The structure of the course is diachronic and thematic. Issues examined include influence, narrative, style, verisimilitude, and modernity/modernism.
ARTH 363 01W is a waitlist for ARTH 363 001. Students will be moved from the waitlist into the class as seats become available, and then notified of their registration via email.

description: Key debates in the history of painting and its institutionalization.
